Fly, Giant

This man-sized insect has large, red, globular eyes, a body covered in hairy bristles, and two rapidly vibrating translucent wings.



Giant Fly

CR 1

XP 400
N Medium vermin
Init +2; Senses darkvision 60 ft., scent; Perception +4
DEFENSE
AC 14, touch 12, flat-footed 12 (+2 Dex, +2 natural)
hp 16 (3d8+3)
Fort +4, Ref +3, Will +1
Immune mind-affecting effects
OFFENSE
Spd 30 ft., fly 60 ft. (average)
Melee bite +4 (1d6+3)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
STATISTICS
Str 14, Dex 15, Con 12, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 9
Base Atk +2; CMB +4; CMD 16 (24 vs. trip)
Skills Fly +2, Perception +4; Racial Modifiers +4 Perception
ECOLOGY
Environment any
Organization solitary or swarm (6-11)
Treasure none


Giant flies are larger relatives of normal flies. Like their lesser cousins, they are most often found in areas of garbage, litter, and refuse. A giant fly resembles a normal fly and can grow to a length of 12 feet, though most average about 6 feet long.

Giant flies attack by biting their opponents.
